meanings.definition: Wave or flourish (something, especially a weapon) as a threat or in anger.
meanings.sent1: He was brandishing a stick at the dog to scare it away.
meanings.sent2: The pirate was brandishing his sword during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was brandishing his toy sword at imaginary dragons.
meanings.sent4: The politician was brandishing promises of change during the campaign.
meanings.sent5: The chef was brandishing his knife skillfully to impress the audience.

meanings.definition: Display or show off (something) in a bold or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: She was brandishing her new phone to her friends at school.
meanings.sent2: The model was brandishing the latest fashion trends on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The peacock was brandishing its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The magician was brandishing his tricks to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was brandishing his skills on the field during the championship game.
